snippet: The move showed a new resolve to enforce discipline after the failure to do so contributed to several debt crises and threatened to undermine the euro.
abstract: European Union finance ministers agree for the first time to punish one of their members for flouting the bloc's budget rules, deciding to suspend payment to Hungary of nearly 500 million euros in development money unless it makes progress on reducing its deficit; move shows a new determination to enforce discipline after failure to do so over the last decade has contributed debt crisis and threatens to undermine the euro.

byline.contributor: Palko Karasz contributed reporting from Budapest.

lead_paragraph: The move showed a new resolve to enforce discipline after the failure to do so contributed to several debt crises and threatened to undermine the euro.

headline.seo: Europe Votes to Halt Aid to Hungary Unless it Cuts Deficit
headline.main: In a First, Europeans Act to Suspend Aid to Hungary Unless It Cuts Deficit
